inference:
The shaded square has a side length of 10. The large square has a side length of 40. The area of the shaded square is $10 \cdot 10 = 100$. The area of the large square is $40 \cdot 40 = 1600$. The ratio of the area of the shaded square to the area of the large square is:

$$\frac{100}{1600} = \boxed{\frac{1}{16}}.$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{16}}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
The shaded square has a side length of 10. The large square has a side length of 40. The area of the shaded square is $10 \cdot 10 = 100$. The area of the large square is $40 \cdot 40 = 1600$. The ratio of the area of the shaded square to the area of the large square is:

$$\frac{100}{1600} = \boxed{\frac{1}{16}}.$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{16}}$. I hope it is correct.
